text: <@UA886MF42> - When you say “you can hide modules” are you referring to custom modules? If so, how are these custom modules hidden? Is it an option within themes? I.e. a setting in dnd_row, dnd_column etc. Are you simply referring to a display:none css on the module on certain breakpoints?
Responsive functionality is in BETA? <@U8THBCFC4> with these options are you able to target mobile/ tablet at your own breakpoints or is HubSpot determining what is mobile / tablet in terms of width?
For now, HubSpot is only offering a predefined mobile breakpoint, but the plan is to open it up to developers for v2 so that you can create your own custom breakpoints

>  Are you simply referring to a display:none css on the module on certain breakpoints?
That’s how it works under the hood, yep. But the hubl syntax that enables this to both render the css _and_ show up as a control for the user in the editor is currently in beta if you’d like to join. We are currently _allowing_ one breakpoint whose name is “mobile”, but the actual media query that goes along with it and is displayed in the editor is defined by the developer.
